column5: I like it...I can't wait for fishin with the kids.. I'm lost in her there holdin' that pink rod and reel. She's doing almost everything but sittin' still. Talkin' bout her ballet shoes and trainin' wheels, and her kittens. And she thinks we're just fishin'.       <iframe title="YouTube video player" width="640" height="390" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/fqOw4pUw1KU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>  Randy

I love when these posts come up as it reminds me how lucky I am as my little girl loves to be out on the water with me hard or soft she loves fishing.  Well since Photobucket will not load for me I will add my pics later
Reminds me of fishing with my dad

I can't wait until my daughter is a bit older so that she can fish with me shes only a year and a half but I will being doing my best to get her out this summer with me for perch. I have taught her how to reel by putting a sinker on her little pink rod and casting it down the hallway so we will se and I hope that my daughter loves fishing as much as your daughters and you Joey. The wife isn't into fishing so we will see. So far shes a daddys girl.  Chris
Great stuff Randy... our two daughters are the fisherpeople.. son a rarity.  Then   Now
Superbe thread Randy Priceless shot on this one for you two    Here's MÃ©lissa at her starting fishing debut:

some of my daughters early years she liked to hold the fish all the time even for her brother.     She has grown up so much and has become a good musky hunter she uses a heavy spinning set up I have to cast but has not landed her frist casting musky but is well on her way with many musky under her belt already. here she is fighting one a couple years ago.  Fall one mid to high 30"er  One from a summer trip to the kawarth lakes   Here best and a blast to be there for her 49 1/4"er last summer yes she landed this on her own. I am very lucky that she loves the outdoors as much as she does. She is still not ready to hole them I dont blame her at all.

Love these posts. My daughter was much more into fishing then my son when she was younger. But that changed when she got a little older  and discovered BOYS   Now she is a parent herself and I'm looking forward to getting out this summer with her and my 3 year old grandson Lucas  Sorry no pictures to share...but I'd love to see as many father/daughter pics as you all can muster. Brings back good memories for me.
Thats awesome Randy my girls love to get out as much as possible, I even did a bday fishin trip after the BD party, what was I thinking

I know you usually have your camera in your bag so make sure you take lots of pics of Lucas...  One of my regrets in life is that I didn't get pics of my kids fishing when they were little (no camera)...  Our Cheryl probably was more enthusiatic about fishing than you and I put together Steve...She wanted me to take her icefishing in January one year and Robert was born near the end of that month...

Great thread Randy and some awesome photos. Fishing is always better when it's with the people you enjoy being with the most.  I've been away from the forum for too long. This is my 1st post in about 6 months.  Here is a pic of my daughter in my boat about 7 years ago. If you look close you can see she has a deathgrip on a minnow. I've had a hard time getting her and her mom to join me on the water. She wants me to leave my boat at an outdoor storage facility this summer so she can park in the garage. I agreed under the condition that the two of them join me in the boat for a day of fishing.
My daughter grew away from fishing at about 6. Hope she comes back around again.

I love these posts.... gives me goosebumps thinking about the hours spent with my daughter..  Her first fish    After school fishing   Her PB smallie   Her "pb" sheepshead    Teaching her friend to fish    Pikin on the back roads     Always practicing her favorite sport

What a GREAT TUNE Randy.... I have never heard it before...  thanks for posting it  Lyrics for those that don;t understand country  I'm lost in her there holdin' that pink rod and reel. She's doing almost everything but sittin' still. Talkin' bout her ballet shoes and trainin' wheels, and her kittens. And she thinks we're just fishin'.  I say Daddy loves you baby one more time, she say's I know, I think I got a bite. An all this laughin', cryin', smilin', dyin' here inside is what I call livin'  (Chours) An she thinks we're just fishin' on the river side, throwin' back what we could fry, drownin' worms an killin' time, nothin' to ambitious she ain't even thinkin' bout what's really goin' on right now but I guarantee this memories a big'in and she thinks we're just fishin'  She's already pretty, like her momma is Gonna drive the boy's all crazy giver her daddy fits and I better do this every chance I get 'cause time is tickin'  (Chours) An she thinks we're just fishin' on the river side, throwin' back what we could fry, drownin' worms an killin' time, nothin' to ambitious she ain't even thinkin' bout what's really goin' on right now but I guarantee this memories a big'in and she thinks we're just fishin'   She ain't even thinkin' bout what's really goin' on right now but I guarantee this memories a big'in and she thinks we're just fishin' Yeah, aww she thinks we're just fishin' We ain't only fishin' This ain't about Fishin'
I'm working on a slideshow set to this song for Megan... she's gonna love it!  Randy
I need to find another Omemee up in Bruce County  We used to go 2 -3 times per week for my daughter who started with these WGSF and was quickly becoming the "Crappie Queen"
